medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient began having abdominal pain on ___, accompanied by 4 episodes of nonbloody vomiting. The abdominal pain persisted with + fever to 100, headache, body aches, and urinary frequency. The symptoms were preceded by approximately 2 weeks of abdominal distention, which was new for him. He denied chest pain, shortness of breath, hematemesis, hematochezia.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Vascular vs Alzheimer dementia, benign prostatic hypertrophy (underwent negative prostate biopsy), cataract (s/p R cataract surgery), remote dysphagia (resolved x ___ years), history of headache attributed to Aricept, memory loss followed by Dr. ___ believed to be due to microvascular infarcts, osteoarthritis, osteopenia, polyuria, history of kidney "crystals".
medical_history.family_history: His father had dementia and died at ___. His mother died her ___ from natural causes. His brother had diabetes.
